title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Scranton
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview. Very welcoming throughout the interview. The conversation was somewhat informal. No hard hitting questions come to mind. I was pleased with my experience at university of Scranton.
Interview Questions: They asked questions during the interview.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Scranton in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: First interview was via Zoom with dept chair and another administrator ; second interview was in person at the department with chair, administrative assistant and associate professor; included a tour of the department and general overview of the position
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; Why do you want to work here; Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Physics Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Scranton
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application, had an interview.  It was a laid back encounter where a current physics professor just had a discussion with me.  We discussed classes, students, lab set up, and grading.
Interview Questions: What is something you enjoy about physics that makes you qualified for the tutoring position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Scranton (Scranton, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I just went into my professor office hours and asked for a research job. We talked about the research and ourselves. It was an easy process. He was passionate about his work.
Interview Questions: Why do you seek this job?

title: Telethon Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Scranton (Scranton, PA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward questions and basic interview questions . Did a mock Phonathon phone call as part of the interview process which you are told about before and have time to prepare

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Scranton (Scranton, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Quick process of going into the office and answering a few questions. Very informal and easy. Don't need to prepare very much. Bring resume and some work from the subject you wish to tutor
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Scranton (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Met with some people and discussed day to day duties and what had interested me in the job. They asked if I was physically capable of handling some of the work load.
Interview Questions: What interested you in applying here.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Scranton
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simple and direct. Based solely off of my resume and experiences that prepared me for this role. They also inquired about my future goals and how this would support those
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are qualified for this

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Scranton (Scranton, PA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: To be a Research Assistant, you have to be a student first. Then all you have to do is talk to the professor. Each professor has different area. Some of them have grants, which means there is a chance you can get paid.

title: Director of Information Security Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Scranton (Scranton, PA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
They brough four individuals, of whom they described as being exceptional candidates, in to inverview for the position. However, they offered none of them the position, and said that they had to re-evaluate the position. How does a supposedly intelligent group of people not fully evaluate the position before even posting it -- let alone bringing four "exceptional candidates" in for an eight hour interview? I'd suggest that it's poor leadership and knowledge.

Funny, as the position has been reposted, and looks the same as it did before. I'd suggest that they brought them in to poach ideas, and they need more ideas so they opened it up to a new round of "exceptional candidates." This is catfishing at it's best.

I'd be very wary about this position, this organization and particulary their leadership.
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation, and how did you deal with it?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Scranton (Scranton, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
They have an online system for applying. Now that I'm on the inside, I see that you really need to fill these forms out correctly. It isn't some automated process, it is the hiring manager reading word for word what you input. Be careful with the application website. 

The on site interviews were long. I met for one on one for an hour with 3 of my peers, an hour with my boss and an hour with my bosses boss.
Interview Questions: The questions weren't difficult. They were pretty standard. I would say University of Scranton lacks a certain level of professionalism when it comes to interview knowledge and skills.
